author: A D
text:
Oviya’16, an inter school drawing competition, was held in Arunai Engg College

Simbudevan, film director, presenting the certificate to students at the Oviya'16 art competition at Arunai Engineering College, Tiruvannamalai, on Wednesday.

Participating in competitions is very important and whether you win it or not does not matter, cartoonist-turned-film-director, Simbudevan told students.

He was speaking to school students who participated in Oviya’16 an inter school drawing competition that was held in Arunai Engineering College here on Wednesday. Sharing his experience with students he said that he used to participate in a lot of competitions in his school days and mostly he failed to win any prizes in the initial years.

However after a period of persistent efforts he managed to get 16 state level prizes in a year. R.Venugopal, Senior Deputy Chief Designer, The Hindu, told the students that artists cannot be produced the way engineers are produced from engineering colleges.

The artists are open to the criticism from members of the society. ‘Only a good ‘rasika’ could become a good artist. Not only to become a painter, but to shine in any branch of art one needed the quality of appreciating beauty, he added.
title: Participation is more important than winning: Simbudevan
